channel.title: Age
channel.description:
I don't really know how to start this off, so I'll just talk about my current situation. There are a couple girls I'm interested in, but they are both sophomores in high school (Grade 10) and I'm a senior (Grade 12). I've been getting teased a bit for liking jailbait or being a pedophile, but that got me thinking because I don't go after girls based on looks.
So what's the big deal? Sure, if we were still in a relationship when I graduated things would be difficult, but I'm talking just short-term. It is only two years, and that's two school years. What do you guys think? One of the girls is actually more mature than I am and most people I know, so it just doesn't make much sense to me.
~Lin

item.title: Age
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

If they’re old enough to count, they’re old enough to mount.

I don’t care about age, if I marry a guy older than me, I don’t mind, I don’t see anything weird about 15 and 18 year olds going out either, or w/e it is in your case

Pfft in the 1600s 35 year olds would marry 12 year olds

Read full topic

item.title: Age
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Chassy13:

I don’t know, I just worry about the opinions of underage sex (which isn’t my priority).

Here in Florida theres a close-in-age exemption:
Unlawful sexual activity with certain minors.-- (1) A person 24 years of age or older who engages in sexual activity with a person 16 or 17 years of age commits a felony of the second degree, punishable

Its not my priority either, but the law basically blurs the line between the 16-18 gap to make it more manageable.

Bowser jr:

So you workouts have finally paid of? Are you saying that she is mature like a 18 year old, or that you are like a 16 year old?

I look too young for girls my age and I get along with everyone for the most part, id say I just act a bit younger.

Read full topic

item.title: Age
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:54, topic:462689”][quote author=Chassy13 link=topic=565893.msg4123104#msg4123104 date=1350003961]
I kind of fall under the same boat Lin, I have a few girls I’m interested in that are in year 9. I am in year 12 as well…
[/quote]
No issue there if you actually approach it correctly.

Im 18 and talking to a 15 year old who is turning 16 soon, but I only look like a 16 year old and turned 18 a month ago. As long as the maturity level is tolerable there is no huge issue.

Funny me I quoted Einstein when we first started talking and she told my sister I was weird, but now its an ongoing inside joke :)[/quote]
So you workouts have finally paid of? Are you saying that she is mature like a 18 year old, or that you are like a 16 year old?

Read full topic

item.title: Age
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:51, topic:462689”]While I haven’t taken the time to read the rest of the thread, I’m just going to state my opinions.

Age gaps only exist as an issue for certain regions. Let’s say we have someone who is 12 and 15. There is a large level of maturity to jump from in that area, therefor a relationship at that age level would not be the best for either party. However, as we increase to anything 30+, any age gap of 5-7 becomes acceptable. As one progresses toward the 40s, you can get away with even 10. However if we’re talking about someone who 19 and 23, again, that’s just to far apart.

For your scenario, I find it slightly weird but not horrible. Dating one grade out of yours is typically fine, but two depends on what we’re talking about. If you’re like 18 and she’s 16, that could all just come down to the level of maturity that exists in her. If it’s 17 and 15, that’s generally fine. If I were you, I’d just go for it. Fuck what others think. Fuck what I just wrote. You’re in highschool, do what you want. Non of this will matter in a few years time anyway.[/quote]
A lot of nice facts here, even at a 2yr difference, it also depends on the maturity of both of them, some people are more ahead of their age than others.

Read full topic

item.title: Age
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

While I haven’t taken the time to read the rest of the thread, I’m just going to state my opinions.

Age gaps only exist as an issue for certain regions. Let’s say we have someone who is 12 and 15. There is a large level of maturity to jump from in that area, therefor a relationship at that age level would not be the best for either party. However, as we increase to anything 30+, any age gap of 5-7 becomes acceptable. As one progresses toward the 40s, you can get away with even 10. However if we’re talking about someone who 19 and 23, again, that’s just to far apart.

For your scenario, I find it slightly weird but not horrible. Dating one grade out of yours is typically fine, but two depends on what we’re talking about. If you’re like 18 and she’s 16, that could all just come down to the level of maturity that exists in her. If it’s 17 and 15, that’s generally fine. If I were you, I’d just go for it. Fuck what others think. Fuck what I just wrote. You’re in highschool, do what you want. Non of this will matter in a few years time anyway.

Read full topic

I kind of fall under the same boat Lin, I have a few girls I’m interested in that are in year 9. I am in year 12 as well…
[/quote]
What country are you from? It seems like every country refers to classes differently.[/quote]

USA. We are in a school of only around 250 kids in a city of around 2.2k. Our school is full of assholes, and they would probably give you shit for it, but it’s not really that. I don’t know her opinions on it, or my parents, etc. I’m 17. She is probably 14 or 15.

item.title: Age
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“Lil_Smok3r, post:45, topic:462689”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=565893.msg4119579#msg4119579 date=1349544530]

Thats fine, i think people misunderstand that big age gaps at a young age are inapproriate i.e. 14 year old + 18 year old.
2 years is fine

There was some girl on Teenspot who was 16 and claiming she was in love with a 30 year old man and wanted to know if they could have a future. Sounds like a troll, I know, but she had pictures of them and sounded actually serious. >.>

I’ve talked to a girl that was playing some shit like that and was serious, some people are just stupid.

OT: That gap doesn’t matter, if you’re both in high school, it’s fine. Even when you go off to college, She will be a junior, so that still doesn’t matter. Your friends are just fucking with you, that’s what theY’RE There for.
[/quote]
Fixed Some Stuff
OT: Who Cares What Your Friends Think, If they tease you for going out with someone 2 Years younger, they simply aren’t your friends are they? Think about it like that.[/quote]
Fixed some stuff for you, faggot.
Why Do You Type Like This.

Read full topic
